synsets.definition: A state of peaceful happiness and satisfaction with one's circumstances without excessive desire for more
Chinese concept of being satisfied with having enough; contentment that comes from recognizing sufficiency rather than seeking excess
Japanese concept of gentle motivation and purpose that gives life meaning without overwhelming passion or apathy
Sanskrit term for contentment and acceptance of what one has, representing balanced satisfaction without craving
Arabic concept of contentment and satisfaction with divine provision; balanced acceptance without excess or want
Southern African philosophy of balanced human flourishing through community connection and mutual care
Lakota concept of balanced relationship with all life forms, representing harmonious engagement without exploitation
Portuguese concept of gentle, bittersweet longing that is pleasant rather than painful; moderate emotional arousal
The practice of avoiding extremes in pleasure-seeking or sensory experience; maintaining healthy limits
Korean concept of warm, affectionate feeling and connection that is steady and moderate rather than intense
Danish concept of comfortable, cozy satisfaction and gentle pleasure in simple moments and togetherness
Arabic concept of moderate aesthetic pleasure and musical joy that uplifts without overwhelming the senses
Kenyan concept of pulling together with moderate, sustained energy for community benefit
Swedish concept of 'just the right amount' - not too little, not too much, but perfectly balanced
Hebrew concept of genuine joy and celebration that is meaningful without being excessive or hedonistic
Sanskrit term for happiness and pleasure that arises from ease and comfort rather than intense stimulation
Japanese aesthetic of finding beauty and satisfaction in imperfection and impermanence; gentle appreciation
Andean concept of living well in harmony with community and nature; sustainable satisfaction and joy
A state of peaceful happiness and calm satisfaction without agitation or excessive stimulation
A state of comfortable engagement and moderate arousal where activity feels effortless and satisfying
Buddhist concept of taking pleasure in others' happiness; moderate joy that is generous rather than self-focused
Greek concept of putting soul and love into one's work; moderate passion that is sustainable and fulfilling
To experience pleasure or satisfaction in a conscious, balanced way without excess or compulsion
Norwegian concept of outdoor living that brings moderate joy and arousal through connection with nature
Sanskrit concept of moderate aesthetic flavor or emotion that enhances experience without overwhelming
Characterized by avoiding extremes in pleasure-seeking; maintaining healthy sensory and emotional regulation
Spanish concept of pleasant time spent lingering at table after a meal; gentle social satisfaction and connection
Japanese concept of enduring difficult situations with patience and dignity; moderate arousal through inner strength
